body:
I‚Äôve added a couple clarifying notes to the [d3-force 1.0 release notes](https://github.com/d3/d3-force/releases/tag/v1.0.0). To answer your questions:
1. The only effect of _layout_.size in 3.x was to set the focal point of the ‚Äúgravity‚Äù force. This force has been replaced by the positioning forces [d3.forceX](https://github.com/d3/d3-force/blob/master/README.md#forceX) and [d3.forceY](https://github.com/d3/d3-force/blob/master/README.md#forceY), and you can set the focal point using [_x_.x](https://github.com/d3/d3-force/blob/master/README.md#x_x) and [_y_.y](https://github.com/d3/d3-force/blob/master/README.md#y_y), respectively. Or if you prefer, you can use [d3.forceCenter](https://github.com/d3/d3-force/blob/master/README.md#forceCenter) to keep the view centered on a given point, set via [_center_.x](https://github.com/d3/d3-force/blob/master/README.md#center_x) and [_center_.y](https://github.com/d3/d3-force/blob/master/README.md#center_y).
2. There‚Äôs no _start_ event because the only way to start the simulation‚Äôs internal timer is by creating a new [d3.forceSimulation](https://github.com/d3/d3-force/blob/master/README.md#forceSimulation) or by calling [_simulation_.restart](https://github.com/d3/d3-force/blob/master/README.md#simulation_restart). So, if you want to do something on start, just call your code after doing one of the above.

Here's an example of running the force layout for 10 ticks before triggering rendering on tick:

http://bl.ocks.org/syntagmatic/6f30a2d719871d041c6eace2193b9f33

``` javascript
d3.range(10).forEach(simulation.tick);

simulation.on("tick", ticked);
```

A few more examples of tweaking forces to get things centered and laid out reasonably. The second two are large and CPU-intensive.

http://bl.ocks.org/syntagmatic/954b31aa8b8beb91b30ccb0c9e57f6ce
http://bl.ocks.org/syntagmatic/c334d4293b72a2d1b8827c70e88d4d4f
http://bl.ocks.org/syntagmatic/75c5ca501200b0cf7a5958b4e404f777 (this one goes offscreen)

@syntagmatic Thanks!

@mbostock Concerning your (2) above: if I'm not mistaken, _dragging a node_ was also a way to restart the simulation internal timer. Has this changed?

There is no _force_.drag in v4, though see d3/d3-force#44 for a possible future enhancement.

So, it‚Äôs entirely up to you whether you want to restart the simulation‚Äôs timer on drag. The [first example linked](http://bl.ocks.org/mbostock/ad70335eeef6d167bc36fd3c04378048) from the [d3-force README](https://github.com/d3/d3-force/blob/master/README.md) demonstrates one technique for implementing dragging. The [d3-drag README](https://github.com/d3/d3-drag/blob/master/README.md) links to more examples.

Please use [Stack Overflow tag d3.js](https://stackoverflow.com/tags/d3.js) to ask for help. Although I make an effort to assist everyone that asks, I am not always available to provide help promptly or directly. Stack Overflow provides a better collaborative forum for self-help: tens of thousands of D3-related questions have already been asked there, and some answered questions may be relevant to you.

When asking for help, please include a link to a live example that demonstrates the issue, preferably on [bl.ocks.org](http://bl.ocks.org). It is often impossible to debug from code snippets alone. Isolate the issue and reduce your code as much as possible before asking for help. The less code you post, the easier it is for someone to debug, and the more likely you are to get a helpful response.

If you have a question about D3‚Äôs behavior and want to discuss it with other users, also consider the [d3-js Google Group](https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/d3-js) or [joining](https://d3-slackin.herokuapp.com/) the [d3-js Slack](https://d3js.slack.com/).

Thank you! ü§ó
You edit the code on https://gist.github.com or on the command-line using git commands (see [Let‚Äôs Make a Block](https://bost.ocks.org/mike/block/) and [gistup](https://github.com/mbostock/gistup).
The other sites are okay, but I don‚Äôt like them as much because they introduce additional code and structure that makes it harder to run the debugger and browser developer tools.

@vrupesh Please use [Stack Overflow tag d3.js](https://stackoverflow.com/tags/d3.js) to ask for help. If you have a question about D3‚Äôs behavior and want to discuss it with other users, also consider the [d3-js Google Group](https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/d3-js) or [joining](https://d3-slackin.herokuapp.com/) the [d3-js Slack](https://d3js.slack.com/).
